questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_190911
questions.main: Michigan Stadium contains multiple materials from the grass(?) on the field to the concrete and metal of the seats. On top of that it has multiple slopes which will increase or decrease the sunlight exposure around the stadium. We will be visiting Michigan Stadium on a hopefully sunny day to be determined to make measurements of the temperatures around the bowl of the stadium. What spot in the stadium would you expect to have the warmest surface?
questions.answer: Virtually any answer is OK as long as it's in the stadium amd likely in the sunshine.

mcq.option: A) the days and nights are of equal length except at the poles
B) at noon the sun is overhead at the equator
C) the earth is not tilted toward nor away from the sun

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_190911
questions.main: During the winter solstice in the Northern Hemisphere:

mcq.option: A) astronomical winter begins in the Northern Hemisphere
B) the noon sun is overhead at 23.5¬∞S latitude
C) at middle latitudes in the Northern Hemisphere, this marks the longest night of the year

questions.main: Where is the hottest region in the United States? Where is the coldest?

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_190911
questions.main: As the air temperature increases the air's capacity for water vapor:

mcq.option: D) is unrelated to air temperature and can either increase or decrease

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_190911
questions.main: At the North Pole the sun will rise above the horizon on ____ and set below the  horizon on ____.

mcq.option: B) divergence of the air aloft
C) lifting along some barrier such as a mountain or front

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_190911
questions.main: Which of the following is correct at the time of the summer solstice in June?

mcq.option: A) it marks the beginning of astronomical summer in the Northern Hemisphere
C) the noon sun is overhead at the Tropic of Cancer
